response.original_title: California Executive Guide: Resolving McAfee "Neural Engine Failure" and AI-Scam Locks
response.overview: California AI Security Helpline: 1-855-508-8955 Technical Root Cause Analysis: In 2026, California tech professionals are reporting a surge in Neural Engine Failures. Technically, McAfeeâ€™s 2026 "Scam Alert AI" performs real-time sentiment analysis on your communication ports. If your NPU (Neural Processing Unit) drivers are mismatched after a 2026 system update, the AI engine triggers a False-Positive Lockdown. This "Logic Lock" freezes your Outlook and browser, interpreting legitimate business requests as "Social Engineering Swarms." Advanced Restoration Protocols: AI-Handshake Reset: Access the McAfee dashboard and manually re-calibrate the "Scam Sensitivity" slider to release the port lock. NPU Driver Sync: Use the McAfee Software Install Helper to force-sync the security software with your hardware's specific AI instruction set. Winsock Buffer Purge: Run netsh winsock reset to clear the network filters that the AI agent placed on your IMAP/SMTP ports.
response.tagline: California Executive Guide: Resolving McAfee "Neural Engine Failure" and AI-Scam Locks
